result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Roberto Mero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered total fine to be paid within 60 days, or civil judgment to be entered as penalty for nonpayment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Roberto Mero

records.addlTxt:
02:53 PM Attorney Stephen Michael Govin in court by zoom and has authorization to appear on behalf of the Defendant Carlos Roberto Mero.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$330.50 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.

Hearing on July 29, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

  Pursuant to the Wisconsins Supreme Courts Order issued March 22, 2020, this hearing is being held via video and telephone conferencing.  You may appear in person or view this hearing by using the following link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFIfRDbN_gyr53z5FPku-og
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Hearing on September 16, 2020 at 09:15 am.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with Court's calendar.**

  Pursuant to the Wisconsins Supreme Courts Order issued March 22, 2020, this hearing is being held via video and telephone conferencing.  You may appear in person or view this hearing by using the following link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFIfRDbN_gyr53z5FPku-og
Waukesha County Criminal Status Sheet filed by Atty. Govin.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

records.addlTxt: Notice and Order for All Criminal Cases (CF) and (CM) signed by Judge Maria S. Lazar 04/27/2020

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division at (262) 548-7485 to make an appointment and sign their bond within five (5) business days. Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

04:15 PM Defendant Carlos Roberto Mero by telephone with attorney Stephen Michael Govin who also appeared by telephone.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes a timely request for substitution has been filed in this matter of Judge Laura Lau.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Once matter has been reassigned, Court will contact counsel to schedule a date.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division at (262) 548-7485 to make an appointment and sign their bond within five (5) business days. Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Court notes defendant lives out of State and he is to work with the Clerk's office and his attorney to make arrangements on how to sign his bond.  Check Case scheduled for April 30, 2020.
Initial appearance on April 22, 2020 at 01:00 pm.
